title: Conductors - conducting sphere w external charge

content.prompt: A neutral conducting sphere has two points, 1 and 2, on its outer surface as shown in the figure. A positively charged metal rod is brought close to the sphere from the left side near Point 1. Which of the following is a correct statement about the electric potential at the two points when the positively charged rod is nearby and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: The electric potential at Point 1 is lower than that at Point 2 because the electrons move freely to be on the side close to the positive object.
The electric potential at Point 1 is lower than that at Point 2 because the protons move freely to be on the side furthest from the positive object.
The electric potential at Point 1 is equal to the potential at Point 2 because the charged sphere is neutral, meaning there are no charges to move around the sphere.
The electric potential at Point 1 is equal to the potential at Point 2 because the sphere is a conductor so its surface must be an equipotential surface.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
